channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2024040786
item.description:
Report X-2024040786

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-13
  • City: HERMITAGE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When they were unloading the trailer, the PH realized that the box was wet and proceeded to inform the manager, who put the box in a black container inside a plastic bag. DescribePack: This box did not have any type of inner packaging and the plastic bottles did not have any protection, one of the bottles had a hole on the top of it. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was put inside the bin and inside a plastic hazmat bag and we put absorb cloth underneath.

item.title: Report X-2024040803
item.description:
Report X-2024040803

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package came off trailer #952349 already damaged wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 1gallon plastic bottles of zep driveway & concrete cleaner concentrate one 1gallon plastic bottle had a loose and open cap allowing 1gallon to release no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. leaking package was discovered when package handler Evette Trosterud picked up the package not realizing that it was a leaking hazmat liquid from the leaking bottle got on her arms and cloths. DescribePack: one 1gallon plastic bottle of zep driveway & concrete cleaner concentrate had a loose and open cap allowing 1 gallon to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat lined tote

item.title: Report X-2024040893
item.description:
Report X-2024040893

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 2 x 1 gallon metal paint cans of universal flattening agent one 1 gallon metal paint can had a loose lid allowing 1 gallon to release. each can was in a plastic bag and had a plastic ring around the lid no other slotted partitions or absorbent was found facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one 1 gallon metal paint can had a loose lid allowing 1 gallon to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report X-2024040853
item.description:
Report X-2024040853

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was transported from unload to van line on tugger cart, once it arrived at line it was unloaded and placed on top of an IC , then another heavy IC was placed on top and crushed the HazMat package. Being sandwiched between 2 heavy IC's crushed contents and it began to leak at closure cap. Poor handling by package handlers. DescribePack: Top of heavy plastic bag at cap, began to leak from pressure of being sandwiched between two heavy IC's . Leakage was at the top and cap location. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once it was noticed HazMat package was leaking, it was moved to HazMat cage and placed in white salvage drum.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded by a package handler during the outbound sort. Package handler noticed that box was wet and manager retrieved box and placed in QA to be processed. DescribePack: The box was wet around the corner and it appears that the lid of one bottle was slightly loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The lids were tightened and package was placed in a hazmat bin to be processed.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Unload manager called for a package that was leaking inside the trailer. Upon arrival, a leaking package was found and absorbent powder was placed on the residue. Upon inspection, loose caps were found inside the package along with 0 inner packaging. DescribePack: Loose cap from the pressure of of many bottles of liquid caused the leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Leaking package was placed inside a bag with a plastic container. Absorbent powder was poured on the residue or leak on the trailer floor.

item.description:
Report E-2024040364

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia dock employee was transferring waste containers from a service vehicle to a trailer at Veolia's ten-day intransit facility in Philadelphia, PA when he discovered a 5 gallon pail had tipped over and leaked. The container was up righted and overpacked and the small spill was quickly cleaned up. Further investigation revealed the proper closure was not used for the container by the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2024040491
item.description:
Report X-2024040491

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOX WAS LEAKING IN UNLOAD TRAILER AND GIVEN TO QA. QA OPENED BOX FOR INSEPCTION AND DISCOVERED IT TO BE A LARGE BATTERY. THE BATTERY WAS WRAPPED IN PLASTIC BUT THERE WAS A HOLE IN THE PLASTIC CAUSING THE SPILL TO FUTHER LEAK. DUE TO THE HAZARDOUS NATURE OF A BATTERY THE PACKAGE WAS PUT IN A SAVAGE DRUM DescribePack: SMALL HOLE IN PLASTIC COVEREING BATTERY. BATTERY ITSELF WAS WET DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS SECURED IN DRUM IN THE CAGE

item.title: Report X-2024040654

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA WAS CALLED TO UNLOAD FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT. UPON DISCOVERY FOUND THAT 1 OF 4 BOTTLES INSIDE BOX WERE LEAKING. SPILLING HAZMAT WAS CONTAINED IN A HAZMAT TOTE AND HAZMAT PROCEDURES WERE STARTED DescribePack: LID ON 1 OF THE GALLONS WAS LOOSE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT PROCEDURE, PLACED IN HAZ TOTE AND PUT IN HAZ CAGE
